bibl.title: Connected Hinterlands. Proceedings of Red Sea Project IV Held at the University of Southampton, September 2008
bibl.note: 22 contributions. - Part I. Ancient peoples of the Red Sea. - Part II. The Southern hinterlands: Eritrea and Yemen. - Part III. A transitional sea: The late-Antique and early Islamic Red Sea. - Part IV. People, ports and products: The medieval Red Sea. - Part V. Travelling the Red Sea: Pilgrimage, navigation and seafaring. - Pp. vi-vii: L.Bl., Introduction; - 231-232: Select index.
bibl.seg: Lucy Blue, John Cooper, Ross Thomas & Julian Whitewright (edd.), Connected Hinterlands. Proceedings of Red Sea Project IV Held at the University of Southampton, September 2008 = Society for Arabian Studies Monographs. 8 = BAR International Series. 2052.
Oxford, Archaeopress, 2009, 4°, x-232 pp., nombr. ill. ISBN 978-1-4073-0631-5. £43.

22 contributions. - Part I. Ancient peoples of the Red Sea. - Part II. The Southern hinterlands: Eritrea and Yemen. - Part III. A transitional sea: The late-Antique and early Islamic Red Sea. - Part IV. People, ports and products: The medieval Red Sea. - Part V.
